Legal_Issue: Whether the Officer breached procedural fairness by not disclosing extrinsic evidence or erred in evaluating the Applicant's work history
Evidence_Assessment: Officer reviewed SSO contributions; Applicant provided a letter of exemption but no additional proof; Officer consulted publicly available SSO information
Decision_Outcome: Permanent Resident (PR) application refused due to insufficient evidence of work experience
Burden_of_Proof: On the Applicant to demonstrate eligibility
Credibility_Factor: Applicant failed to provide corroborating evidence for claimed work history
Legal_Rule: Procedural fairness requires disclosure of concerns to allow response; officers must reasonably evaluate evidence but need not reference all evidence
Procedural_Issue: Alleged failure to disclose extrinsic evidence (publicly available SSO data)
Grounds_for_Claim: Breach of procedural fairness, unreasonable evaluation of work history
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No breach; concerns were communicated and opportunity to respond was given
Key_Evidence_Considered: Letter of SSO exemption, publicly available SSO records
Legal_Framework: IRPA subsection 72(1) – Judicial review of decisions
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged refusal of PR application based on work experience assessment
Defendant_Response: Officer acted within authority and followed fair process
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Insufficient proof of qualifying work experience
Applicable_Process: Permanent Residence application under economic class
Governing_Rule: Procedural fairness and reasonableness standard in administrative decision-making
